column4: Are you sure you can't get whatever it is you're trying to get from the official repositories?
Programs you're trying to install how?
.debs that i downloaded from kde-apps.org
even fesity doesnt seem to have kdelibs4. it has the same package as edgy
Ah. Yes, the ubuntu package is kdelibs4c2a, and no you don't need feisty packages.
You're going to have to modify the dependencies in the poorly made debs or install from source.
how do i modify the deps ?

Uhh... not easily. To be honest I wrote myself quite a complicated shell script to handle the unpacking and repacking. I advise you to install from source... unofficial debs will probably cause problems because they're compiled for different libraries.
nope. i checked. they're not there. konverter, kmencoder and kooldock
Then I suggest you install from source.
alright thanks
what would happen if i forced it ?
Especially since, randomly googling for kooldock, I find that a) the debian package link is broken, and b) it's for Debian Sid, which isn't even ubuntu and probably won't be compatible.
Then it will complain about unresolved dependencies every time you use apt-get or synaptic for anything.
shit. definitely had enough of that. thanks mate
and if that command says yes, does that mean its enabled ?
If the renderer string is not "GLX indirect" then it is enabled.
Direct rendering must be "yes" for 3D to be on, but it can be "yes" without it being on.
Mesa DRI Intel ?
If it's not indirect, it's accelerated. Intel's drivers are GPL so they are handled by Mesa, the 3D infrastructure.
right thanks
